metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27783 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A XSS vulnerability was discovered in python-lxml's clean module. The module's parser didn't properly imitate browsers, which caused different behaviors between the sanitizer and the user's page. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to run arbitrary HTML/JS code.

notes.Note: sbeattie> according to lxml upstream, first commit does not fix completely, second commit is needed/fixes issue better.

criterions.comment: lxml: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
